title: Worked Solution
text:
The quantum numbers provided are:

- $$n$$ $$=$$ 4: The principal quantum number, which defines the energy level or shell.
- l $$=$$ 1: The azimuthal (angular momentum) quantum number, which defines the subshell.

For l $$=$$ $$1$$, the corresponding subshell is the $$p-subshell$$. The principal quantum number $$n$$ $$=$$ $$4$$ tells us that it is the 4th energy level.

Thus, the orbital described by the quantum numbers $$n$$ $$=$$ $$4$$ and l $$=$$ $$1$$ is the $$4p$$ orbital.
